div.p: No. 3612, pp. 146-7, unit 71, VPRS 1187/P, outward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office of Victoria.

Document is a circular (p. 146) to the heads of 14 departments (listed p. 147) within the Chief Secretary’s Department.
The accompanying circular is the critical point here to understand the retirement rules and it ought to be at least extracted. The following cross reference allows an inference, but for cross ref pourposes from other letters it would be useful to know what the circular contained.
Circular

I have the honour, by direction of the Chief Secretary, to enclose for your information and guidance copy of a Circular I have received from the Under Treasurer on the subject of the retirement from the Public Service of officers on their attaining the age of 60.

I shall be glad to receive as early as possible the List referred to in the first paragraph of the Circular as regards your Department
See M to H. Moors, 28 September 1885.

I am to request that the further List mentioned in the Second Paragraph may be furnished to me not later than the 1st of March next; and that with respect to officers who may attain the age of 60 after the 30th of June 1886 your recommendation in such case may be submitted to me at least four months before the completion of their 60th year.
